skill.author: Joseph OBrien

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation/reference skill containing only markdown files. No executable code, no file I/O, no network calls, no environment access, and no external command execution. The skill only provides instructional content about skill structure patterns.

content.value_statement: Creating new skills requires understanding proper structure and format. This example skill provides reference patterns and best practices for building well-organized skills that follow Claude Code conventions.
actual_capabilities: Demonstrates YAML frontmatter format for skill metadata
Shows proper markdown structure with required sections
Provides reference guide for skill creation
Defines optional sections like scripts and assets
limitations: Does not execute any code or commands
Does not access files beyond its own documentation
Does not connect to external services or APIs
Does not provide executable scripts or tools

use_cases.title: Create new skills
use_cases.description: Use as a template when building new skills for Claude Code to ensure proper structure.

use_cases.title: Document skill capabilities
use_cases.description: Follow the pattern of clear purpose, workflows, and examples when writing skill docs.

use_cases.title: Enforce standards
use_cases.description: Use as reference to review and validate skills created by team members.

prompt_templates.title: Create Basic Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new skill following the example-skill structure. Include YAML frontmatter with name, description, author, version, and category.

prompt_templates.title: Add Documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Write the 'When to Use' and 'What This Skill Does' sections for my new skill following the example-skill format.

prompt_templates.title: Define Workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a workflow section for my skill with 4-5 clear steps following the example-skill pattern of Identify, Review, Apply, Validate.

prompt_templates.title: Add Best Practices
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a Best Practices section and Anti-Patterns section to my skill documentation following the example-skill guidelines.

output_examples.input: How do I structure a new skill?
output: Start with YAML frontmatter containing name, description, author, version, and category
Add a clear 'When to Use' section with specific trigger conditions
Create a 'What This Skill Does' section listing core capabilities
Define a step-by-step 'Workflow' with 4-6 actionable steps
Provide concrete 'Examples' with scenarios and approaches

best_practices: Keep skills focused on a single domain or capability to maintain clarity
Include specific examples and use cases that demonstrate real applications
Bundle reference files in the references/ directory when they add value
anti_patterns: Creating overly broad skills that try to do too many things
Skipping the 'When to Use' section which helps users identify when to apply the skill
Missing examples or use cases that demonstrate practical applications

faq.question: What tools support this skill format?
faq.answer: This skill format is compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. The structure follows general conventions that work across AI assistants.

faq.question: What are the required sections for a skill?
faq.answer: Required sections include When to Use, What This Skill Does, Core Principles, Workflow, Best Practices, Anti-Patterns, and Examples.

faq.question: Can I include executable scripts with my skill?
faq.answer: Yes. Optional sections include Scripts in scripts/ directory and Assets in assets/ directory. Only include these if they add clear value.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: This is a documentation-only skill. It reads only its own markdown files and contains no executable code, network calls, or external access.

faq.question: How do I troubleshoot skill creation issues?
faq.answer: Compare your skill structure against the example-skill. Ensure YAML frontmatter is valid and all required sections are present with proper formatting.

faq.question: How does this differ from other skill templates?
faq.answer: This example follows the AGENT_SKILL template format. It provides comprehensive documentation patterns including workflows, examples, and anti-patterns.
